item.description:
A little out of the box adventure for this weekend takes us out of our comfort zone of New England. After taking counsel from Chris Baker of the Hudson Valley Hikers Meet Up JoAnn and I did some research and came up with a couple of awesome hikes in the Catskills. We're talking a 10.25 mile hike over challening terrain on day 1 and a shorter more peaceful hike with waterfalls, streams and great scenery on day 2.

Day 1 will feature the main attraction. We'll bag three peaks on this point to point hike. Most of the work will be getting up to the top of the first summit, Blackhead Mountain (3,942'.) This trail is EXTREMELY steep at times and through one stretch it rises about 1300 ft. in less than a mile. Beyond Blckhead we'll have an elevation change, 500' down and then back up again, before proceeding to Black Dome peak (3,985.) Next we'll follow a forested ridge to Thomas Cole Mountain (3,944.) From there it's all down hill baby! Both of the Blacks have some areas with rock scrambles and exposed rock faces.

The trail head to start is Batavia Kill and we'll end at Barnum Road. Total hiking time estimate is 7 hours. We'll have to work out some car spotting for this jaunt. Challenge Rating: DIFFICULT.

Car Spotting: We'll meet Sat morning at 10 AM in Maplecrest at the intersection of County Rd 40 and 56. We'll drop the cars at the trail end and then shuttle up to the trail head.

Day 2 It's said that West Kill Mountain (3,880') has some of the nicest views of all the mountain trails in the Catskills. The Buck Ridge Lookouts afford open and far-ranging views of many of the other surrounding mountains. The beginning of the trail features the Diamond Notch Falls. We'll ascend 1,750 vertical feet over 6.5 miles. Estimated hiking time is 4.5 hours.

Catskill Hiker: http://www.catskillhiker.net/Catskill35/peaks/blackhead.shtml

 

Saturday Overnight: Still researching hotels and campgrounds.

Directions to Trail Head from New York State Thruway (Easist, not the shortest):

  • Take New York State Thruway to Exit 21 (Catskill).
  • Take a left out of the NYS Thruway entrance road.
  • Go approximately 1/2 mile
  • Take a right onto Route 23 West
  • Go somewhere around 18 miles on Route 23.
  • Take a left onto County Rt 65 (Main Care Gas Station on Right - Condos on left).
  • Go approximately 0.7 miles on Route 65.
  • Take left onto Rt 65A.
  • Go approximately 0.3 miles on Rt 65A .
  • Continue Straight onto Rt 40 after stop sign.
  • Go approximately 1.8 miles on Rt 40 until intersection with County Road 56.
  • Rt 56 (3-way intersection in Maplecrest).
  • Stop here at the intersection. We'll send some vehicles up to the trail end.
  • After dropping the cars off at the trail end we'll continue to trail head
  • Follow Rt 56 approximately 4.2 miles
  • Continue off the asphalt road to the gravel road until you reach the DEC parking lot. GPS: N42 17.334 W74 06.900
  • Do NOT block driveway in the DEC parking lot. This goes to someones house.
  • Do NOT drive beyond the DEC parking lot. This is someones driveway.
  • Land around the DEC parking lot and the beginning of the trail is PRIVATE land. Please respect private landowners.

Mandatory Equipment List:
This list could change based on trail conditions just prior to the hike.

  • Synthetic shirt and waterproof pants. No cotton. No jeans.
  • Wool/ synthetic socks.
  • Sturdy Hiking Boots suitable for uneven terrain.
  • Rain / Wind Jacket with hood. No Ponchos.
  • Warm fleece layer
  • Warm fleece outer layer or wool hat
  • 3 liters Water (tablets or water filter)
  • Headlamp
  • Spare batteries for Headlamp (Lithium have the longest life)
  • Trail Snacks
  • Lunch
  • Map/Compass/Whistle
  • Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's hardly a reason not to have one in your pack)
  • Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)

Other Equipment Suggestions:

  • Sunglasses & sunscreen
  • insect repellant
  • Medications/First Aid Supplies
  • Repair Kit/Knife
  • Trekking Poles
  • Gaiters
  • Light-weight Emergency Shelter
  • Camera-Binoculars

T.P.

No Jeans, Sneakers, or Cotton clothing on the hike!

Car Pooling Recommended: Use the comments section to hook up.

Guests: If a member wants to bring a guest please contact me via email.

Liability Waiver: As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.name: CAT Hike
